info.title: Import Letter Of Credit
info.description:
Import Letter of Credit (ILC) is an undertaking to pay issued by a bank on behalf of its corporate customer (an importer) to a beneficiary (an exporter) for procured goods or services. A payment is released to the exporter against a presentation of specified documentation and in accordance with the terms of the transaction.

The ILC reflects the transaction from the perspective of an importer (the ILC applicant) and the importer's bank, typically known as the issuing bank.

'Issuance' is the initial event that creates the master ILC transaction. This event could only be created once per ILC. If changes to the basic details of the ILC are needed, an 'Amend' event could be entered. Once the beneficiary submits their documents and claims the payment, a 'Claim Received' event is created. A claim could be continued in an 'Outstanding Claim' event if it is not completed in a single event. The 'Amend' and 'Claim Received' events can be created multiple times and at any point in the ILC lifecycle prior to its expiry.

There are two kinds of IDs in this API: id and masterId. The id is the identifier returned for events such as 'Issuance', 'Amendment' and 'Claim Received'. The masterId is the identifier returned for the ILC master and it is created together with the 'Issuance' event. A master ILC transaction can have one 'Issuance' event and multiple 'Amendment', 'Claim Received' and 'Outstanding Claim' events.

Notifications are sent when the transaction is either awaiting response or authorised. The notification contains the id and masterId which could be used to retrieve details on the transaction.
info.x-finastra-short-description: Perform multiple Import Letter of Credit events such as Issuance, Amendment and Claim Received, and retrieve corresponding details

tags.name: Issuances
tags.description: An import letter of credit issuance event allows you, as the issuing bank, to initiate an import letter of credit in response to the receipt of an application from an importer, who is usually a customer of your bank or the bank of the importer.

tags.name: Amendments
tags.description: A letter of credit can be amended using an Amend event at any time between the release of the Issuance event that created it and book-off event. Typically, an amendment will be initiated by the issuing bank at the request of the applicant. The issuing bank then passes details of the amendment on to the next bank in the processing chain, which will record the details and then inform the next advising bank or the beneficiary, as appropriate.

tags.name: Claims Received
tags.description: Claim received event allows the user to log information about an initial claim made by the presenter and to record the receipt of documents. This event could be closed with or without making payment whilst awaiting documents or responses to inquiries.

tags.name: Outstanding Claims
tags.description: The Outstanding Claim event, which allows you as the issuing bank to continue processing a claim, initiated by a Claim Received event in order to enter details of documents subsequently received or of a response from the applicant. In case of protracted correspondence with the applicant or the presenter, any number of Outstanding Claim events can be created, with the final event actually making the payment or rejecting the claim. A letter of credit may have more than one Claim Received event, and each Claim Received event may have several Outstanding Claim events associated with it. However, only one Outstanding Claim event can be in progress for each claim at any one time.

tags.name: Master Transaction
tags.description: Master Transaction lists the most recent authorized and saved details of the LC. This API should only be used after authorization of the issuance event.

post.summary: Issue an import letter of credit
post.description: This call posts an import letter of credit master transaction and issuance event in FTI.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New import letter of credit issuance

201.description: Import letter of credit issuance was created successfully

get.summary: Get import letter of credit issuance by id
get.description: Returns a single import letter of credit issuance

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of import letter of credit issuance to return

200.description: Success in getting import letter of credit issuance by ID

put.summary: Update an issuance of an import letter of credit
put.description: Update an import letter of credit issuance event by ID that is in exchange step in FTI, awaiting a response. This could only be used for issuance events in FTI that are in exchange step.

parameters.name: X-External-Context-ID
parameters.description: An encoded string that contains the details of an ILC issuance transaction that is waiting for a response from the external system. This field is only supplied in the ILC Events API where the user must subscribe to.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ILC Issue deferred response body

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the import letter of credit to be updated

200.description: Success in getting import letter of credit issuance by ID

post.summary: Amend an import letter of credit
post.description: Creates an amend event in an import letter of credit in FTI. Entered data using this API will be the new and valid values to be saved in the transaction. If nothing is entered in a field, the value from the issuance event or the previous amend event will be retained.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New import letter of credit amendment

201.description: Import letter of credit amendment was created successfully

get.summary: Get Import Letter of Credit - Amendment by ID
get.description: Returns a single import letter of credit amendment using the provided id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of import letter of credit amendment to return

200.description: Success in getting import letter of credit amendments by LC ID

put.summary: Edit an amendment of an import letter of credit
put.description: Update an import letter of credit amend event by ID that is in exchange step in FTI, awaiting a deferred response. This could only be used for amend events in FTI that are in exchange step.

parameters.name: X-External-Context-ID
parameters.description: An encoded string that contains the details of an ILC amendment transaction that is waiting for a response from the external system. This field is only supplied in the ILC Events API where the user must subscribe to.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ILC Amendment deferred response body

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the amendment of the import letter of credit to be updated

200.description: Success in updating import letter of credit amendment by Id

post.summary: Claims received of an import letter of credit
post.description: Creates a claims received event in FTI, recording the receipt of documents and logging information about the initial claim made by the presenter.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New import letter of credit claim received

201.description: Import letter of credit claim received was created successfully

get.summary: Get Import Letter or Credit - Claim received by ID
get.description: Returns a single claim received in an ILC by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of import letter of credit claim received to return

200.description: Success in getting import letter of credit claim received

put.summary: Update a claim received of an import letter of credit
put.description: Update an import letter of credit claims received event by ID that is in exchange step in FTI, awaiting a deferred response. This could only be used for claims received events in FTI that are in exchange step.

parameters.name: X-External-Context-ID
parameters.description: An encoded string that contains the details of an ILC claims received transaction that is waiting for a response from the external system. This field is only supplied in the ILC Events API where the user must subscribe to.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ILC Claims received deferred response body

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the import letter of credit

post.summary: Outstanding claim of an import letter of credit
post.description: Creates an outstanding claim event in FTI, continuing the processing of a claim initiated by a Claim Received event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New import letter of credit outstanding claim

201.description: Import letter of credit outstanding claim was created successfully

get.summary: Get Import Letter or Credit - Outstanding claim by ID
get.description: Returns a single outstanding claim in an ILC by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of import letter of credit outstanding claim to return

200.description: Success in getting import letter of credit outstanding claim

put.summary: Update an outstanding claim of an import letter of credit
put.description: Update an import letter of credit outstanding claim event by ID that is in exchange step in FTI, awaiting a deferred response. This could only be used for outstanding claim events in FTI that are in exchange step.

parameters.name: X-External-Context-ID
parameters.description: An encoded string that contains the details of an ILC outstanding claim transaction that is waiting for a response from the external system. This field is only supplied in the ILC Events API where the user must subscribe to.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ILC Outstanding claim deferred response body

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the import letter of credit

get.summary: Get Import Letter of Credit Master by ID
get.description: Returns a single import letter of credit master using the provided master-id.

parameters.name: masterId
parameters.description: ID of import letter of credit master to return

200.description: Success in getting import letter of credit master by ID

EventIdentity.title: Event Identity
EventIdentity.description: Unique identifier of the event transaction

id.description: The unique identifier of the import letter of credit event transaction - auto generated in TI.

MasterIdentity.title: Master Identity
MasterIdentity.description: Unique identifier of the LC master transaction

masterId.description: The unique identifier of the import letter of credit master transaction - auto generated in TI.

MasterReference.title: Master Reference
MasterReference.description: The generated reference of the master transaction in FTI

owningTransactionBankReference.description: Bank's Master reference for this transaction. The value returned by FTI for this field could change if Master status is set to Pending.

MasterStatus.title: Master Status
MasterStatus.description: Status of the Letter of Credit master transaction

masterStatus.description: The status of the LC master transaction.

EventStatus.title: Event Status
EventStatus.description: Status of the Letter of Credit event transaction

eventStatus.description: The status of the LC event transaction.

ActionItem.title: Action Item
ActionItem.description: The details of any key instructions or data from the client relating to the transaction that needs attention from the bank users.

messageData.description: Message data of the instruction or information from the client that needs attention from the bank users.
messageData.example: Finance details have been arranged for this transaction. Contact the Finance department with reference 09020019-001 for further information

messageDescription.description: Message description of the instruction or classification of the data that needs attention from the bank users.

messageInfo.description: Additional information to be displayed in the notification

messageNumber.description: Free format message number or identifier of the notification that could be set by the client.

actioned.description: Identifies whether the notification or instruction has been actioned by the client.

Attachment.title: Attachment
Attachment.description: The documents received in this transaction.

docId.description: The reference id of the document in the DMS. Mandatory only when a document related to this transaction has been uploaded in TI via API. This is the response returned by API Document Management.

dmsId.description: The reference id of the set Document Management System in FTI. Mandatory only when a document related to this transaction has been uploaded in TI via API. If internal DMS is used, the accepted and returned value by API Document Management is FTIDMS. This is the response returned by API Document Management.

docType.description: The document type code. This must match one of the bank defined document types in the system. For examples, BOL stands for Bill of Lading, BOE for Bill of Exchange and GEN for General.

isBankDocInternal.description: Identifies if attachment is internal to bank or not

batchId.description: The batch identifier of the document

Charge.title: Charge
Charge.description: The charge details of the transaction.

issuanceChargesPayableBy.description: The party - the beneficiary or the applicant - responsible for paying issuing bank's charges.

taxPayableBy.description: The party - your customer or the party liable for charges - responsible for paying any tax due on the letter of credit or its charges

overseasChargesPayableBy.description: The party - the beneficiary or the applicant - responsible for paying your overseas charges

preferredCurrency.description: The currency in which your bank's own charges will be collected. If you leave this field blank, the system uses the currency of the letter of credit. Where the charges are for the applicant, the setting here is overridden by the applicant's preferred currency. Follows ISO 4217 Alpha 3 currency code.

accountNumber.description: The bank account number from which charges are to be taken

deferCharges.description: Specify whether your own charges are to be collected now or deferred until payment

Narrative.title: Narrative
Narrative.description: The narratives of the letter of credit.

goodsDescription.description: The description of the goods being delivered under the terms of the letter of credit

documentsRequired.description: The description of documents required to support the transaction

additionalConditions.description: Additional conditions of the transaction. This field may also be used to specify the details of a conditional transhipment and partial shipment

specialPaymentConditionsForBeneficiary.description: The special conditions applicable for the beneficiary, for example, post financing request or conditions.

specialPaymentConditionsForReceivingBank.description: The special payment conditions applicable for the receiving bank without disclosure to the beneficiary.

Shipment.title: Shipment
Shipment.description: The shipment details of the letter of credit.

from.description: The place of dispatch or the place of shipment indicated in transport document

to.description: The final destination of the goods

portOfLoading.description: The port or airport where the goods were loaded

portOfDischarge.description: The port or airport for which the goods are destined

date.description: The shipment date of the transaction. Either use this field to specify an actual date or use shipment period. Follows ISO 8601.

period.description: The period of time during which goods are to be loaded on board/dispatch/taken in charge. Either use this field or date to specify the shipment date of the goods.

partialShipment.description: Identifies whether partial shipment is allowed

incoTerms.description: Incoterms or purchase terms. This should match with the incoterm codes available in the system (ex. CFR = Cost and Freight)

incoPlace.description: The named location of the incoterm. This must be populated when incoTerms has a value.

insuranceForBuyer.description: Specify if the insurance cover is to be provided by buyer. If set to false, the seller will cover the insurance.

freightPayment.description: Specify if freight is prepaid or paid on collection

presentationDays.description: The number of days after shipment date within which the document must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation. Use presentationPeriodNarrative to specify another type of date other than shipment date

presentationPeriodNarrative.description: Specify another type of date other than shipment date

documentsToBeSentBy.description: The method to be used to send documents

numberOfDeliveryItems.description: The number of mailings to be made. Accept values 1, 2, and 3 only.

line1.description: Line 1 of the presentation period narrative

line2.description: Line 2 of the presentation period narrative

line3.description: Line 3 of the presentation period narrative

line4.description: Line 4 of the presentation period narrative

Payment.title: Payment
Payment.description: The payment details of the letter of credit.

creditAvailableBy.description: The type of payment for the documentary credit

tenor.description: The tenor or terms of payment of the LC. This should only be populated when creditAvailableBy value is set to ACCEPTANCE, DEFERRED-PAYMENT OR NEGOTIATION.

mixedPayDetail.description: The details of mixed payment. This is mandatory only when creditAvailableBy value is MIXED-PAYMENT.

draftsDrawnOn.description: The party where drafts are drawn on. This field should only be used when creditAvailableBy value is SIGHT-PAYMENT, ACCEPTANCE OR NEGOTIATION

draftsDrawnOnBank.description: The name and address of the bank on which drafts are drawn. This field must be used only when draftsDrawnOn is NAMED-BANK

creditAvailableWith.description: The party where drafts are drawn on. This field should only be used when creditAvailableBy is ACCEPTANCE, SIGHT-PAYMENT, DEFERRED-PAYMENT OR NEGOTIATION

creditAvailablewithBank.description: The name and address of the bank where the credit is available. Must be populated only when creditAvailableWith has value NAMED-BANK.

creditAvailablewithCityBank.description: The named City wherein the credit is available at any bank. Must be populated only when creditAvailableWith has value ANY-BANK-IN-CITY.

creditAvailablewithCountryBank.description: The named Country wherein the credit is available at any bank. Must be populated only when creditAvailableWith has value ANY-BANK-IN-COUNTRY. Follows ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

invoicePercent.description: The percentage of the invoice value of the goods that the transaction covers.

draftsDrawnByRole.description: The party that will draw the draft. This should only be populated when creditAvailableBy is set to ACCEPTANCE, MIXED-PAYMENT, NEGOTIATION OR SIGHT-PAYMENT.

draftsDrawnBy.description: The details of the party who will draw the draft. This must be populated only when draftsDrawnByRole is NAMED-NEGOTIATING-BANK.

BankNarrative.title: Bank Narrative
BankNarrative.description: Name and Address details of the named bank.

name.description: Full name of the bank. If the customer ID within FTI is known, input the ID in uppercase in this field and disregard the succeeding address fields. Otherwise, populate this field with the name of the bank.

line1.description: Line 1 of the mixed payment details

line2.description: Line 2 of the mixed payment details

line3.description: Line 3 of the mixed payment details

line4.description: Line 4 of the mixed payment details

Tenor.title: Tenor
Tenor.description: The tenor or terms under which the payment is scheduled details of the letter of credit.

maturityDate.description: This is used to define a payment due date as an actual date. This must be blank if period, fromAfter and start under Tenor are populated. Follows ISO 8601.

period.description: The period of the tenor (ex. 3D = 3 Days, 3M = 3 Months, 3Q = 3 Quarters, 3W = 3 Weeks, 3Y = 3 Years). This must be blank if maturity date under Tenor is populated.

fromAfter.description: Used to indicate whether the tenor period will be calculated 'From' or 'After' the base date. This must be blank if maturity date under Tenor is populated.

start.description: The base date to be used to identify the payment due date. This must be blank if maturity date under Tenor is populated.

narrative.description: This is used when based date to calculate due date is not included in 'start' options. This must only be used when start is set to OTHER.

Amount.title: Amount
Amount.description: The amount details of the letter of credit.

currency.description: The currency of the transaction. Follows ISO 4217 Alpha 3 currency code.

tolerance.description: The tolerance type of the transaction. If value is set to ABOUT, tolerance will be set to +/- 10%. If value is set to EXACT, tolerance will be set to 0. If value is set to NOT-EXCEEDING, tolerance will be set to +0% and -5%.

minPercentAmountTolerance.description: The minimum percentage tolerance relative to the documentary credit amount. This should only be populated when tolerance is set to value OTHER.

maxPercentAmountTolerance.description: The maximum percentage tolerance relative to the documentary credit amount. This should only be populated when tolerance is set to value OTHER.

minAmountTolerance.description: The minimum tolerance amount of the transaction. This should only be populated when tolerance is set to value MIN-OR-MAX. The entered amount must not be lesser than the LC amount.

maxAmountTolerance.description: The maximum tolerance amount of the transaction. This should only be populated when tolerance is set to value MIN-OR-MAX. The entered amount must not be greater than the LC amount.

AdditionalAmount.title: Additional Amount
AdditionalAmount.description: The additional amount details of the letter of credit.

additionalAmount.description: Any additional amounts covered such as insurance, freight, interest etc.

additionalAmountCurrency.description: The currency of the additional amount. Follows ISO 4217 Alpha 3 currency code. This must be provided if additional amount is available.

additionalAmountNarrative.description: Additional information about the additional amount

Confirmation.title: Confirmation
Confirmation.description: The confirmation details of the letter of credit.

instruction.description: The instruction for the requested confirmation party

chargesPayableBy.description: -> The party responsible- the beneficiary or the applicant - for the payment of confirmation charges. This field is mandatory when 'instruction' is set to CONFIRMED or MAY-ADD

requestedConfirmationPartyRole.description: -> The party - Advising Bank, Advise Through Bank , or another bank- that is requested to add its confirmation. This is mandatory when 'instruction' is set to Confirm or MayAdd. If set to 'OTHER', party details of requested confirmation party should be indicated in the 'requestedConfirmationParty' field.

requestedConfirmationParty.description: The party that is requested to add its confirmation. This must be populated when requestedConfirmationPartyRole is set to OTHER.

ApplicableRule.title: Applicable Rule
ApplicableRule.description: The rule the credit is subject to

id.description: The rule the credit is subject to

narrative.description: The credit is subject to any other rules. Only used if 'id' is set to OTHER

RevolvingDetail.title: Revolving Detail
RevolvingDetail.description: The revolving details of the letter of credit. These fields are used when 'revolving' is set to true

revolving.description: Identifies if documentary credit is revolving.

cumulative.description: Identifies if the revolution is to be cumulative.

period.description: The period at which the credit is to revolve. (ex. 3D = 3 Days, 3M = 3 Months)

revolutions.description: The number of times the documentary credit is to revolve.

nextDate.description: The date on which the first revolution is to take place. Follows ISO 8601.

noticeDays.description: If notification is required, specify the number of days before each revolution that notice should be created.

chargeToPeriod.description: Indicate the period for calculating charges

NameAndAddress.title: Name and Address
NameAndAddress.description: The full name and address of the party

Party.title: Party
Party.description: Used for defining information of the parties - Applicant, Beneficiary, Advising Bank etc.- available in the transaction

customerId.description: The customer ID of the party within FTI, if available. If populated with a valid value, the saved values in the FTI Customer record will be used instead of the values entered on the succeeding Party fields.

nameAndAddress.description: The full name and address of the party

country.description: The country of the party. Follows ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

postalCode.description: The zip code or postcode of the party

swiftAddress.description: The SWIFT BIC of the party

reference.description: The reference of the party. If the party is the principal of the transaction and event is initial, the value entered in this field will be the 'Their Reference' value of the master in FTI. If the party is principal and event is succeeding, this value will be the reference of the event transaction.

contactName.description: The contact name of the party

contactNumbers.description: The phone contact numbers of the party

telexDetails.description: The telex details of the party

email.description: The email address of the party

ContactNumber.title: Contact Number
ContactNumber.description: Phone contact numbers of the party

type.description: Phone number type. The list below is indicative rather than exhaustive.

answerBack.description: Telex answer back of the party

AmendmentDetails.title: Amendment Details
AmendmentDetails.description: Import letter of credit amendment details

amendDate.description: The date of the amendment. Follows ISO 8601.

amendmentNarrative.example: The following details of the letter of credit has been amended...

amendmentNumber.description: The amendment number of this transaction

beneApprovalRequired.description: Identifies whether amendment requires beneficiary approval

amendmentChargesPayableBy.description: The party responsible for the payment of the amendment charge

amendmentChargeOtherText.description: Narrative when amendment charges is to be paid by a party other than the applicant nor the beneficiary. Mandatory when amendmentChargesPayableBy is set to OTHER-PARTY

EventReference.title: Event Reference
EventReference.description: Bank's reference for this event transaction.

owningTransactionBankEventReference.description: Bank's reference for this event transaction. The value returned for this field could change and is not yet final if Event status is set to In-progress.

MasterEvents.title: Master Events
MasterEvents.description: The events under the Import Letter of Credit Master

events.description: The high-level detail of an import letter of credit event transaction.

MasterEventsDetails.title: Master Events Details
MasterEventsDetails.description: The events and corresponding details under the Import Letter of Credit Master

eventCode.description: The code of an Import Letter of Credit event. Sample values for the events that could be created using this API are 1) 'ISI' for Issue, 2) 'NAMI' for Amend and 3) 'CRC' for Claim Received.

eventName.description: The set configurable name of an Import Letter of Credit event.

eventReference.description: Bank's reference for this event transaction. The value returned for this field could change and is not yet final if Event status is set to In-progress.

crossReference.description: The event reference which this event is related to. For example a 'Beneficiary Response to Amend' event will have cross reference value AMD001 which is the event reference of the amend event that the beneficiary responded to.

swiftMessageInitiated.description: Indicates if the transaction in the system is created due to an incoming SWIFT message.

MasterEventsMainDetails.title: Master Events Main Details
MasterEventsMainDetails.description: The events and high-level corresponding details under the Import Letter of Credit Master

ClaimResponse.title: Claim Response
ClaimResponse.description: The details on the applicant's response to a claim.

claimReference.description: The reference of the claim being approved or rejected

sender.description: The party who sent the response to the issuing bank with regards to the claim.

narrative.description: The details relating to the response by the presenter.

refusalNarrative.description: The detailed narrative on the presenter's refusal on the claim.

RefusalNarrativeLine.title: Refusal Narrative Line
RefusalNarrativeLine.description: Narrative lines for the refusal of claim.

line.description: The detailed narrative on the presenter's refusal on the claim.

ClaimResponseAction.title: Claim Response Action
ClaimResponseAction.description: A user-defined code of the response action set in FTI.

responseActionId.description: A user-defined code of the response action set in FTI.

ClaimResponseType.title: Claim Response Type
ClaimResponseType.description: The claim response type if the response action ID is not known.

responseType.description: If responseActionId is not known, this field should be populated with the response classification. APPROVAL means that the claim is accepted and agreed upon by the presenter while REFUSAL means that the claim is rejected by the presenter. The set value is used to find the default response action. This field should not be populated when responseActionId is populated.

ClaimNarrative.title: Claim Narrative
ClaimNarrative.description: Narrative lines of the claim response.

line.description: The detailed narrative on the claim response.

ILCCommon.title: ILC Common
ILCCommon.description: Fields common to Issuance, Amendment and Claims Received events.

inputBranch.description: The code of the branch where the transaction is being created

behalfOfBranch.description: The branch code of the behalf of branch

actionItems.description: Key instructions or data from the client

SenderReference.title: Sender Reference
SenderReference.description: The reference of the sender of this transaction (if known) which will be used in a validation in the system.

senderReference.description: The reference of the sender of this transaction (if known) which will be used in a validation in the system.

SenderId.title: Sender Identity
SenderId.description: The customer ID in FTI of the sender of this transaction (if known)

senderId.description: The customer ID in FTI of the sender of this transaction (if known)

ILCIssueAmendCommon.title: ILC Issue Amend Common
ILCIssueAmendCommon.description: Fields common to Issuance and Amendment events.

adviseDirect.description: Identifies if LC is to be advised directly to the beneficiary.

adviseThruBankAccount.description: Account number of the advise through bank party.

applicationDate.description: The application date of the letter of credit. Follows ISO 8601.

beneficiaryAccountNumber.description: The account number at overseas bank of the beneficiary

domesticExpiry.description: Identifies if the LC expires in the bank's operating country.

expiryDate.description: The latest date for presentation under the documentary credit. Follows ISO 8601.

expiryPlace.description: The place where documents may be presented

instructionsToAdvisingBank.description: Any instructions to the advising bank

instructionsToPayingBank.description: Any instructions to paying/accepting or negotiating bank

issueBy.description: The method how the letter of credit is to be communicated

issueDate.description: The issue date of the letter of credit. Follows ISO 8601.

active.description: Identifies if the LC is active

standby.description: Identifies if the LC is a standby LC. This should only be populated when the LC is a form of Documentary Credit.

ILCIssuanceRequest.title: ILC Issuance Request
ILCIssuanceRequest.description: Trade Import Letter Of Credit Issuance definition in the request body

ILCIssuance.title: ILC Issuance
ILCIssuance.description: Trade Import Letter Of Credit Issuance definition in the response body

ILCAmendmentRequest.title: ILC Amendment Request
ILCAmendmentRequest.description: Trade Import letter of credit amendment definition in the request body

ILCAmendment.title: ILC Amendment
ILCAmendment.description: Trade Import letter of credit amendment definition in the response body

ILCClaimRequest.title: ILC Claim Request
ILCClaimRequest.description: Trade Import Letter Of Credit Claim Received object definition in the request body

ILCClaim.title: ILC Claim
ILCClaim.description: Trade Import Letter Of Credit Claim Received object definition in the response body

ILCOutstandingRequest.title: ILC Outstanding Request
ILCOutstandingRequest.description: Trade Import Letter Of Credit Outstanding Claim object definition in the request body

ILCOutstanding.title: ILC Outstanding
ILCOutstanding.description: Trade Import Letter Of Credit Outstanding Claim object definition in the response body

ILCMaster.title: ILC Master
ILCMaster.description: Trade Import Letter Of Credit Master

Detail.title: Detail
Detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

title.description: A short summary of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

type.description: The type of problem encountered. Data that did not pass the swagger requirements will have type PAYLOAD VALIDATION. API calls with data that passed the swagger requirements validation but encountered another error will have type CORE VALIDATION.
